Module COMP2042.CW.hfyxc3
Package brickdestroyer.model.entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
brickdestroyer.model.entities.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity, Movable
public class Player extends Object implements Entity, Movable
Player is a concrete class used to represent the entities control by the player in the game of Brick Destroyer. This class contains all the properties and behavior of a player such as the color, move amount, constraint of a player. The player class can only move on horizontal axis of the game window.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Player(javafx.geometry.Point2D ballPoint, int width, int height, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle container)
    Creates a new player rectangle shape with the given initial position, size, color and the movement behavior depending on the size of the game window.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(javafx.geometry.Point2D ballPoint, int width, int height, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle container)
      Creates a new player rectangle shape with the given initial position, size, color and the movement behavior depending on the size of the game window.
      Parameters:
      ballPoint - The initial position of the player.
      width - The width for the X-axis of the player.
      height - The height for the Y-axis of the player.
      container - The size of the game window.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      Move and update the player coordinate to the new x and y position in the game window with the constraint of not going out of the defined min/max value in the game window. This method is called to update the new position of the player in the game window.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(javafx.geometry.Point2D position)
      Move the player to a specified X and Y coordinate. This method is called in the game to move the player to the specified initial position.
      Specified by:
      moveTo in interface Movable
      Parameters:
      position - a Point2D x and y position that can only be positive value. It defines the new position location of the ball in the game window.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stop the movement of the player.

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft()
      Moves the player to the left of the screen. This method allows the horizontal left movement of the player in the game windows.

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight()
      Moves the player to the right of the screen. This method allows the horizontal right movement of the player in the game windows.

    • getPlayerFace

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getPlayerFace()
      Getter method for the property of the shape player such as the position, shape and so on. This method is called to check if the ball collide with the player.
      Returns:
      the shape of the player.

    • getBorderColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getBorderColor()
      Getter method for the border color of the player. It defines the stroke color of the player in the game window.
      Specified by:
      getBorderColor in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Color that contains the sRGB value of the border color of the player.

    • getInnerColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getInnerColor()
      Getter method for the inner color of the player. It defines the fill color of the player in the game window.
      Specified by:
      getInnerColor in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Color that contains the sRGB value of the inner color of the player.

    • getXPosition

      public double getXPosition()
      Getter method for the upper-left corner x bound of the player. It defines the x position starting point of the player to be generated and drawn in the game window. The value of it can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getXPosition in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the upper-left x bound of the player.

    • getYPosition

      public double getYPosition()
      Getter method for the upper-left corner y bound of the player. It defines the y position starting point of the player to be generated and drawn in the game window. The value of it can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getYPosition in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the upper-left y bound of the player.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Getter method for the width of the player. It defines the player length in pixels to be drawn on the x plane of the game window. The value of width can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getWidth in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the width of the player.

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Getter method for the height at the of the player. It defines the player length in pixels to be drawn on the y plane of the game window. The value of height can only be positive.
      Specified by:
      getHeight in interface Entity
      Returns:
      a Double that contains the height of the player.

    • getMoveAmount

      public int getMoveAmount()
      This Getter method is created for the purpose of testing PlayerTest.java. Getter method for the move amount of the player. A negative value represent a left movement of the player and right represent the right in pixel.
      Returns:
      an Integer value that is the current moveAmount of the player.

    • getMin

      public int getMin()
      This Getter method is created for the purpose of testing PlayerTest.java. Getter method for receiving the minimum amount of border X position value.
      Returns:
      an Integer value that represent the minimum X position value of how far the player can travel to the left.

    • getBallPoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getBallPoint()
      This Getter method is created for the purpose of testing GameLogicTest.java. Getter method for receiving the minimum amount of border X position value.
      Returns:
      a Point2D value that represent the center x and y position of the player.
